clauses.text: Provider's total liability under this Agreement shall not exceed the total fees paid by Customer in the 12 months preceding the claim.
clauses.notes: Most common liability cap in SaaS agreements

clauses.text: Each party's total liability under this Agreement shall be limited to the greater of (a) the total fees paid or payable in the 12 months preceding the claim or (b) $100,000.
In no event shall either party be liable for indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages, including lost profits, loss of data, or loss of business opportunity.

The liability limitations in this Agreement shall not apply to: (a) death or personal injury caused by negligence; (b) fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation; (c) gross negligence or willful misconduct; or (d) breach of confidentiality obligations.
